abstract: A case involving newspapers in Belgium could affect cases that publishers have brought against the search company in other countries.
snippet: A case involving newspapers in Belgium could affect cases that publishers have brought against the search company in other countries.
lead_paragraph: PARIS, Feb. 13  A Brussels court ruled Tuesday that Google had violated copyright laws by publishing links to articles from Belgian newspapers without permission. Legal experts said the case could have broad implications in Europe for the news indexes provided by search engines.

headline.main: Google Said to Violate Copyright Laws
headline.print_headline: Google Said to Violate Copyright Laws
